長阿含經

The Long Discourses

(二九) 露遮經

29. Lohitya

如是我聞：一時，佛在拘薩羅國1人間遊行，與大比丘眾千二百五十人俱，往詣娑2羅婆提婆羅門村北尸舍婆林中止宿。

  1. 羅＋（國）【宋】【元】【明】. 國 is added to this transliteration elsewhere in DA, so I’ve emended the Taisho for consistency.
  2. 婆羅婆提＝娑羅婆提【宋】【明】 There was confusion with this obscure placename transliteration, evidenced by the inconsistency in this sutra, but the majority of older readings give 娑, which supports the reading of Sālavatī. 婆 would yield Valavatī or Balavatī.

1. Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in Kauśala touring among the people. He was accompanied by an assembly of 1,250 great monks, and they went to the brahmin town of Sālavatī and stopped to rest to the north in a śiṃśapā grove.

時，有婆羅門，名曰露遮，住[＊]婆羅林中，其村豐樂，人民熾盛，[14]波斯匿王即封此村，與婆羅門以為梵分。此婆羅門七世[15]已來父母真正，不為他人之所輕毀，異典三部諷誦通利，種種經書盡能分別，又能善於大人相法、[16]瞻候吉凶、祭祀儀禮。

2. There was a brahmin then named Lohitya1 who was staying in a śāla grove. His town was bountiful and happy, and the people prospered. King Prasenajit had awarded this town to that brahmin as his brahmin due.2 This brahmin was descended from seven generations of fathers and mothers who were proper, so he wasn’t criticized by others. He chanted and fully understood the three divisions of the other canon, and he could entirely discern the various kinds of scriptures. He was also skilled in the way of the great man’s signs, divining fortune and misfortune, and the sacrifices and rituals.3

  1. Lohitya. The Sanskrit name Lohitya is attested in the Sarvâstivāda Dīrghâgama; however, many Central Asian texts give his name as Lokecca. The Chinese transliteration only indicates the first and last syllable (“lo” and “cha”).
  2. Brahmin quarter is probably a translation of brahma-deya, which refers to gifts made to the brahmin caste by rulers and others.
  3. Rather than describe Lohiyta’s virtues, the Pali text immediately states the wrong view that will drive his conflict with the Buddha. cf. DN.12.2.

聞沙門瞿曇釋種子出家成道，於拘薩羅國人間遊行，至尸舍[＊]婆林中，有大名稱，流聞天下，如來、至真、等正覺，十號具足，於諸天、世人、魔、若魔天、沙門、婆羅門眾中自身作證，與他說法，上中下善，義味具足，梵行清淨。「如此真人，宜往覲現，我今寧可往共相見。」

3. He heard that the mendicant Gautama of the Śākya clan who had left the home life [113a] and achieved awakening was touring among the people of Kauśala and had arrived in a śiṃśapā grove. This Gautama had a great reputation that was heard throughout the world. He was a Tathāgata, an Arhat, and a Perfectly Awakened One fully endowed with the ten epithets. Among gods, worldly men, and demons or the assemblies of Māra’s gods, mendicants, and brahmins, he had himself become realized and taught the Dharma to others. It was good in the beginning, middle, and end, complete in meaning and manner, and the purification of the religious life. “I ought to go and have an audience with such a true man as this. I would like to go and pay him a visit now.”1

  1. In the Pali, Lohicca sends his barber both to invite the Buddha and let him know when it’s time to come. This removes the context for Lohitya’s wrong view, which may be why the Pali mentions it before this sequence of events.

時，婆羅門即出彼村，詣尸舍婆林中，至世尊所，問訊已，一面坐。佛為說法，示教利喜，婆羅門聞法已，白佛言：「唯願世尊及諸大眾明受我請。」

4. That brahmin then left his village and went to visit the Bhagavān in that śiṃśapā grove. After making polite inquiries, he sat to one side. The Buddha taught the Dharma for him, clearly teaching it with intelligence adnd joy. After that brahmin heard the Dharma, he said to the Buddha, “May the Bhagavān and the great assemblies clearly accept my invitation.”

爾時，世尊默然受請。

The Bhagavān then accepted his invitation silently.

彼婆羅門見佛默然，知已許可，即從坐起，遶佛而去。去佛不遠，便起惡見言：「諸沙門、婆羅門多知善法，多所證成，不應為他人說，但自知，休與他說為。譬如有人壞故獄已，更造新獄，斯是貪惡不善法耳。」

5. That brahmin saw that the Buddha was silent. Once he knew that he had the Buddha’s assent, he rose from his seat, circled the Buddha, and left. Not far from the Buddha, an evil view occurred to him. “Mendicants and brahmins often know the good Dharma, and many of them realize its fulfillment. They shouldn’t teach it for other people. Knowing it themselves, they desist from giving teachings to others. It’s like a man who makes a new hell after he was destroyed in a former hell. This is just a greedy, evil, and unwholesome Dharma!”

時，婆羅門還至[＊]婆羅林已，即於其夜具辦種種餚饍飲食。時到，語剃頭師言：「汝持我聲，[1]詣尸舍[＊]婆林中，白沙門瞿曇：『日時已到，宜知是[2]時。』」

6. After the brahmin had returned to the sala grove, that night he prepared a variety of delicious food and drink. When they came, he said to his barber, “Take my words to the simsapa grove and tell the mendicant Gautama, ’Once daytime has arrived, you ought to know it’s time.’"

剃頭師受教即[3]行，往到佛所，禮世尊足白：「時已到，宜知[4]是時。」

His barber accepted and performed his instructions. He went to the Buddha and bowed at the Bhagavan’s feet. “Once the day has come, you ought to know that its time.”

爾時，世尊即著衣持鉢，從諸弟子千二百五十人俱，詣[＊]婆羅林。

7. The Bhagavan then put on his robe and took his bown to the sala grove along with his 1,250 disciples.

剃頭師侍從世尊，偏露右臂，長跪叉手，白佛言：「彼露遮婆羅門去佛不遠，生惡見言：『諸有沙門、婆羅門多知善法，多所證者，不應為他人說，但自知，休與他說為。譬如有人壞故獄已，更造新獄，斯是貪惡不善法耳。』唯願世尊除其惡見。」

The barber followed the Bhagavan by his right side, saluted him with his palms together, and said, “That brahmin Lohitya had this wrong view arise not far away when he left the Buddha: ’“Mendicants and brahmins often know the good Dharma, and many of them realize its fulfillment. They shouldn’t teach it for other people. Knowing it themselves, they desist from giving teachings to others. It’s like a man who makes a new hell after he was destroyed in a former hell. This is just a greedy, evil, and unwholesome Dharma!”’ May the Bhagavan remove his evil view.”

佛告剃頭師曰：「此是小事，易開化耳。」

The Buddha told the barber, “This is only a minor matter that’s easily changed.”

爾時，世尊至婆羅門舍，就座而坐。時，婆羅門以種種甘饍，手自斟酌，供佛及僧，食訖去鉢，行澡水畢，取一小牀於佛前坐。佛告露遮：「汝[5]昨去我不遠，生惡見言：『諸沙門、婆羅門多知善法，多所證者，不應為他人說，乃至貪惡不善法。』實有是言耶？」

8. Then, the Bhagavan arrived at the brahmin’s resdience, prepared a seat, and sat down. The brahmin personally served them various delicious foods, providing it for the Buddha and the samgha. When they finished the meal, they left their bowls and went to wash. [113b] They got a small sofa for the Buddha to sit in front. The Buddha then told Lohitya, “Yesterday, not long after you left, you had an evil view: ’Mendicants and brahmins often know the good Dharma, and many of them realize its fulfillment. They shouldn’t teach it for other people. Knowing it themselves, they desist from giving teachings to others. It’s like a man who makes a new hell after he was destroyed in a former hell. This is just a greedy, evil, and unwholesome Dharma!’ Is it true that you said that?”

露遮言：「爾，實有此事。」

Lohitya said, “Yes, it’s true that this happened.”

佛告露遮：「汝勿復爾生此惡見。所以者何？世有三師可以自誡。云何為三？一者剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家修道，於現法中可以除煩惱，又可增益得上人法。而於現法中不除煩惱，不得上人法，己業未成而為弟子說法，其諸弟子不恭敬承事，由復依止與共同住。

9. The Buddha told Lohitya, “Don’t let this wrong view arise again. Why is that? There are three teachers in the world whom it’s possible admonish yourself. Who are the three? One shaves off his hair, wears the three Dharma robes, and leaves home to cultivate the path. Here in the present, he could remove the afflictions, and he could develop and attain a higher human teaching. Here in the present, however, he doesn’t remove the afflictions, and he doesn’t attain a higher human teaching. His work is incomplete, yet he teaches the Dharma for disciples. His disciples don’t respect or serve him. As a result, they have another support and share his abode as equals.

露遮！彼諸弟子語師言：『師今剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家修道，於現法中可得除眾煩惱，得上人勝法。而今於現法中不能除煩惱，不得上人勝法。己業未成而為弟子說法，使諸弟子不復恭敬承事供養，但共依止同住而已。』」

“Lohitya, those disciples say to the teacher, ‘Teacher, now you’ve shaved off your hair, put on the three Dharma robes, and left home to cultivate the path. Here in the present, you could remove the myriad afflictions and attain a higher human teaching. Here in the present, however, you aren’t able to remove the afflictions or attain a higher human teaching. Your work is incomplete, yet you teach the Dharma for disciples, which causes your disciples not to respect, serve, or make offerings to you further. They just share your support and reside here as equals.’”

佛言：「露遮！猶如有人壞故獄已，更造新獄，斯則名為貪濁惡法。是為一師可以自誡。是為賢聖戒、律戒、儀戒、時戒。」

The Buddha continued, “Lohitya, like a man who builds a new prison after destroying an old one, this is called a greedy, degenerate teaching. This is one teacher whom it’s possible to admonish yourself, [and it’s the noble precepts, the discipline, the rules of propriety, and the rule of timeliness.]

又告露遮：「第二師者，剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家修道，於現法中可得除眾煩惱，又1可增益得上人法，而於現法中不能除眾煩惱，雖復少多得上人勝法，己業未成而為弟子說法，其諸弟子不恭敬承事，由復依止與共同住。

  1. 不＝又【宋】【元】【明】

10. “The second teacher shaves off his hair, wears the three Dharma robes, and leaves home to cultivate the path. Here in the present, he could remove the myriad afflictions, and he could develop and attain a higher human teaching. Here in the present, however, he isn’t able to remove the myriad afflictions, although he does attain a little or much of a higher human teaching. His work is incomplete, yet he teaches the Dharma for disciples. His disciples don’t respect or serve him. As a result, they have another support and share his abode as equals.

露遮！彼諸弟子語師言：『師今剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家修道，於現法中可1得除眾煩惱，得上人法。而今於現法中不能除眾煩惱，雖復少多得上人法，己利未成而為弟子說法，使諸弟子不復恭敬承事供養，但共依止同住而已。』」

  1. 得＝可得【宋】【元】【明】

“Lohitya, those disciples say to the teacher, ‘Teacher, now you’ve shaved off your hair, put on the three Dharma robes, and left home to cultivate the path. Here in the present, you could remove the myriad afflictions and attain a higher human teaching. Here in the present, however, you aren’t able to remove the myriad afflictions, although you’ve attained a little or much of a higher human teaching. Your own benefit is incomplete, yet you teach the Dharma for disciples, which causes your disciples not to respect, serve, or make offerings to you further. They just share your support and reside here as equals.’”

佛言：「露遮！猶如有人在他後行，手摩他背，此則名為貪濁惡法。是為二師可以自誡。是為賢聖戒、律戒、儀戒、時戒。」

The Buddha [113c] continued, “Lohitya, like a man who touches another’s back after he turns away, this is called a greedy, degenerate teaching. This is the second teacher whom it’s possible to admonish yourself. This is the noble precept, the discipline, the rule of propriety, and the rule of timeliness.

又告露遮：「第三師者，剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家修道，於現法中可除煩惱，又可增益得上人法，而於現法中不能除眾煩惱，雖復少多得上人法，己利未成而為弟子說法，其諸弟子恭敬承事，依止同住。

11. “A third teacher shaves off his hair, wears the three Dharma robes, and leaves home to cultivate the path. Here in the present, he could remove the myriad afflictions, and he could develop a higher human teaching. Here in the present, however, he isn’t able to remove the myriad afflictions, although he does attain a little or much of a higher human teaching. His own benefit is incomplete, yet he teaches Dharma for disciples. The disciples respect and serve him, sharing support and dwelling as equals.

露遮！彼諸弟子語師言：『師今剃除鬚髮，服三法衣，出家修道，於現法中可得除眾煩惱，少多得上人法，而今於現法中不能除眾煩惱，雖復少多得上人法，己利未成而為弟子說法，諸弟子恭敬承事，共止同住。』」

“Lohitya, those disciples say to the teacher, ‘Teacher, now you’ve shaved off your hair, put on the three Dharma robes, and left home to cultivate the path. Here in the present, you could remove the myriad afflictions and attain a little or much of a higher human teaching. Here in the present, however, you aren’t able to remove the myriad afflictions, although you’ve attained a little or much of a higher human teaching. Your own benefit is incomplete, yet you teach the Dharma for disciples. Your disciples respect and serve you, sharing support and dwelling as equals.’”

佛言：「露遮！猶如有人捨己禾稼，鋤他田苗，此則名為貪濁惡法。是為三師可以自誡。是為賢聖戒、律戒、儀戒、時戒。

The Buddha said, “Lohitya, like a man who plows a field after abandoning his crop, this is a greedy, degenerate teaching. This is the third teacher whom it’s possible to admonish yourself. This is the noble precept, the discipline, the rule of propriety, and the rule of timeliness.

露遮！有一世尊不在世間，不可傾動，云何為一？若如來、至真、等正覺出現於世，乃至得三明，除滅無明，生智慧明，去諸闇冥，出大法光，所謂漏盡智證。所以者何？斯由精勤，專念不忘，樂獨閑居之所得也。露遮！是為第一世尊不在世間，不可傾動。

12. “Lohitya, there’s one Bhagavan who isn’t in the world and cannot be shaken. Who is this one? If a Tathāgata, an Arhat, and a Fully and Completely Awakened One appears in the world up to attains three knowledges, eliminates ignorance, gives rise to the radiance of wisdom, and leaves behind darkness, and produces the great light of Dharma, then that is the realization of the knowledge that the contaminants are ended. What is the reason for that? These are attainments that come from diligence, focus, mindfulness, unforgetfulness, and happiness with dwelling alone. Lohitya, this is the first Bhagavan who isn’t worldly and unshakable.

露遮！有四沙門果。何者四？謂[13]須陀洹果、[14]斯陀含果、[15]阿那含果、[16]阿羅漢果。云何？露遮！有人聞法應得此四沙門果。若有人遮言：『勿為說法。』設用其言者，彼人聞法得果以不？」

13. “Lohitya, there are four fruits of the mendicant. What are the four? They are the fruit of stream entry, fruit of one more return, fruit of no return, and the fruit of the arhat. How is it, Lohitya? Someone who hears the teaching should attain these four fruits of a mendicant. Suppose someone prohibits it by saying, ’Don’t teach the Dharma.’ If he were to apply those words, would that person hear the Dharma and attain the fruits by doing so?”

答曰：「不得。」

“He won’t attain them.”

又問：「若不得果，得生天不？」

“If he doesn’t attain these fruits, does he attain birth in heaven?”

答曰：「不得。」

“He won’t attain it.”

又問：「遮他說法，使不得果，不得生天。為是善心，為不善心耶？」

“To prohibit others from teaching Dharma causes them to not attain its fruits and not attain birth in heaven. Is that a wholesome or an unwholesome thought?”

答曰：「不善。」

“Unwholesome.”

又問：「不善心者，為生善趣，為墮惡趣？」

“Is someone with unwholesome thoughts born in good destinies, or do they fall into bad destinies?”

答曰：「生惡趣。」

He’s born to a bad [114a] destiny.”

「露遮！猶如有人語波斯匿王言：『王所有國土，其中財物王盡自用，勿給餘人。』云何？露遮！若用彼人言者，當斷餘人供不？」

14. "Lohitya, he’s like a man who says to King Prasenajit, ’The country belongs to the king. The wealth in it is entirely for the king’s own use. Don’t share it with anyone else!’ How is it, Lohitya? If he applied that person’s words, would the king end the sharing of it with other people?"

答曰：「當斷。」

“He would stop it.”

又問：「斷他供者，為是善心，為不善心？」

To stop sharing with others: Is that a wholesome thought or an unwholesome thought?

答曰：「不善心。」

“An unwholesome thought.”

又問：「不善心者，為生善趣，為墮惡道耶？」

“Is someone with unwholesome thoughts born in good destinies, or do they fall into bad destinies?”

答曰：「墮惡道。」

“He’ll fall to an bad destiny.”

「露遮！彼亦如是，有人聞法，應得四沙門果。若有人言：『勿為說法。』設用其言者，彼人聞法得果不？」

15. "Lohitya, he’s likewise, someone who hears the Dharma and would attain four fruits of a mendicant. Suppose someone prohibits it by saying, ’Don’t teach the Dharma.’ If he were to apply those words, would that person hear the Dharma and attain the fruits by doing so?”

答曰：「不得。」

He won’t attain it.”

又問：「若不得果，得生天不？」

“If he doesn’t gain these fruits, does he attain birth in heaven?”

答曰：「不得。」

“He won’t attain it.”

又問：「遮他說法，使不得道果，不得生天。彼為是善心，為不善心耶？」

“To prohibit others from teaching Dharma causes them to not attain its fruits and not attain birth in heaven. Is that a wholesome or an unwholesome thought?”

答曰：「不善。」

“Unwholesome.”

又問：「不善心者，為1生善趣，為墮惡道耶？」

  1. The Taisho here has 當 and older readings insert 當 before 墮 to make the verb clauses parallel. I’ve emended the first 當 to 為 to be consistent with the rest of the text.

“Is someone with unwholesome thoughts born in good destinies, or do they fall into bad destinies?”

答曰：「墮惡道。」

“He’ll fall to a bad destiny.”

「露遮！若有人語汝言：『彼娑1羅婆提村封所有財物。露遮！自用勿給人，物當自用，與他何為？』云何？露遮！設用彼言者，當斷餘人供不？」

  1. 波＝娑【宋】【元】【明】 This transliteration makes the most sense.

16. “Lohitya, if someone were to say to you, ‘There’s wealth in that fiefdom of Sālavatī. Lohitya, it’s for your own use; don’t share it with others. Possessions are for your own use. What purpose is there to giving them to others?’ How would it be, Lohitya? If you applied his words, you would stop sharing with anyone else, wouldn’t you?”

答曰：「當斷。」

“I would stop.”

又問：「教人斷他供者，為是善心，為不善心耶？」

“Is teaching people to stop sharing with others a wholesome or an unwholesome thought?”

答曰：「不善。」

“Unwholesome.”

又問：「不善心者，為生善趣，為墮惡道耶？」

“Is someone with unwholesome thoughts born in good destinies, or do they fall into bad destinies?”

答曰：「墮惡道。」

“He’ll fall to a bad destiny.”

「露遮！彼亦如是，有人聞法應得四沙門果，若有人言：『勿為說法。』設用其言者，彼人聞法得果不？」

17. “Lohitya, it’s likewise for someone who hears the Dharma who would attain the four fruits of a mendicant. Suppose someone says, ‘Don’t teach the Dharma.’ If those words are applied, that person wouldn’t hear the Dharma and attain its fruit, would he?”

答曰：「不得。」

He wouldn’t attain them.”

又問：「若不得果，得生天不？」

“If he doesn’t gain these fruits, does he attain birth in heaven?”

答曰：「不得。」

“He won’t attain it.”

又問：「遮他說法，使不得果，不得生天。為是善心，為不善心耶？」

“To prohibit others from teaching Dharma causes them to not attain its fruits and not attain birth in heaven. Is that a wholesome or an unwholesome thought?”

答曰：「不善。」

“Unwholesome.”

又問：「不善心者，為生善趣，為墮惡道耶？」

“Is someone with unwholesome thoughts born in good destinies, or do they fall into bad destinies?”

答[5]曰：「墮惡道。」

“He’ll fall to a bad destiny.”

爾時，露遮婆羅門白佛言：「我歸依佛，歸依法，歸依僧，願聽我於正法中為優婆塞，自今已後，盡形壽不殺、不盜、不婬、不欺、不飲酒。」

18. The brahmin Lohitya then said to the Buddha, “I take refuge in the Buddha, refuge in the Dharma, and refuge in the Samgha. Please permit me to be a laymen in the correct teaching. From this day forward, I will not kill, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or drink alcohol for all my life.”

佛說法已，時，露遮婆羅門聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。

19. After the Buddha had taught the Dharma, the brahmin Lohitya heard what the Buddha had said, rejoiced, [114b] and handed it down.
